title: YASO - Wagner, Mendelssohn and Dvořák
desc: YASO Associate Conductor Henry Shin, hailed for his ?keen sense of timing, charisma and leadership? (Opera Theatre), makes his YASO debut conducting Wagner?s intimate and tender tone poem Siegfried Idyll, a gift to his second wife in celebration of the birth of their son.? Twenty-year-old Peruvian-born YASO Concertmaster Eduardo Rios, lauded for his ?luminous? playing (Aspen Times), performs Mendelssohn?s Violin Concerto in E minor, Op. 64, once considered daring and now one of the most popular violin concertos of all time. YASO Artistic Director Alexander Treger leads the Mendelssohn, and caps the program with Dvo??k?s solemn and evocative Symphony No. 7 in D minor, Op. 70, which showcases the composer at his most exceptional.
